intro: Astragalus viridiformis, commonly known as the greenleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Astragalus viridiformis is also valued for its ecological role in nitrogen fixation and as a food source for various wildlife species.
